Aerodynamictime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputGuy-Manuel and Thomas are going to build a polygon spaceship.You're given astrictly convex(i. e. no three points are collinear) polygon $$$P$$$ which is defined by coordinates of its vertices. Define $$$P(x,y)$$$ as a polygon obtained by translating $$$P$$$ by vector $$$\\overrightarrow {(x,y)}$$$. The picture below depicts an example of the translation:Define $$$T$$$ as a set of points which is the union of all $$$P(x,y)$$$ such that the origin $$$(0,0)$$$ lies in $$$P(x,y)$$$ (both strictly inside and on the boundary). There is also an equivalent definition: a point $$$(x,y)$$$ lies in $$$T$$$ only if there are two points $$$A,B$$$ in $$$P$$$ such that $$$\\overrightarrow {AB} = \\overrightarrow {(x,y)}$$$. One can prove $$$T$$$ is a polygon too. For example, if $$$P$$$ is a regular triangle then $$$T$$$ is a regular hexagon. At the picture below $$$P$$$ is drawn in black and some $$$P(x,y)$$$ which contain the origin are drawn in colored:The spaceship has the best aerodynamic performance if $$$P$$$ and $$$T$$$ are similar.Your task is to check whether the polygons $$$P$$$ and $$$T$$$ aresimilar.InputThe first line of input will contain a single integer $$$n$$$ ($$$3 \\le n \\le 10^5$$$) — the number of points.The $$$i$$$-th of the next $$$n$$$ lines contains two integers $$$x_i, y_i$$$ ($$$|x_i|, |y_i| \\le 10^9$$$), denoting the coordinates of the $$$i$$$-th vertex.It is guaranteed that these points are listed in counterclockwise order and these points form a strictly convex polygon.OutputOutput"YES"in a separate line, if $$$P$$$ and $$$T$$$ are similar. Otherwise, output"NO"in a separate line. You are given a strictly convex polygon $P$ defined by the coordinates of its vertices.  

Define $P(x,y)$ as the polygon obtained by translating $P$ by the vector $(x,y)$.

Let $T$ be the set of all $P(x,y)$ such that the origin $(0,0)$ lies in $P(x,y)$ (both strictly inside and on the boundary).

Determine if polygons $P$ and $T$ are similar.

Input:

* The first line contains an integer $n$ ($3 \le n \le 10^5$) representing the number of vertices.
* The next $n$ lines each contain two integers $x_i, y_i$ ($|x_i|, |y_i| \le 10^9$) representing the coordinates of each vertex.

Output:

* Print "YES" if polygons $P$ and $T$ are similar.
* Print "NO" if polygons $P$ and $T$ are not similar.
You are given a polygon.  Determine if the polygon and a related transformed polygon are similar.
